refnamediv.refpurpose: A widget which displays a list of icons in a grid

refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Properties
refsect1.synopsis: "column-spacing" gint : Read / Write "columns" gint : Read / Write "item-width" gint : Read / Write "margin" gint : Read / Write "markup-column" gint : Read / Write "model" GtkTreeModel : Read / Write "orientation" GtkOrientation : Read / Write "pixbuf-column" gint : Read / Write "reorderable" gboolean : Read / Write "row-spacing" gint : Read / Write "selection-mode" GtkSelectionMode : Read / Write "spacing" gint : Read / Write "text-column" gint : Read / Write

refsect1.title: Signal Prototypes
refsect1.synopsis: "activate-cursor-item" gboolean user_function (ExoIconView *icon_view, gpointer user_data); "item-activated" void user_function (ExoIconView *icon_view, GtkTreePath *path, gpointer user_data); "move-cursor" gboolean user_function (ExoIconView *icon_view, GtkMovementStep step, gint count, gpointer user_data); "select-all" void user_function (ExoIconView *icon_view, gpointer user_data); "select-cursor-item" void user_function (ExoIconView *icon_view, gpointer user_data); "selection-changed" void user_function (ExoIconView *icon_view, gpointer user_data); "set-scroll-adjustments" void user_function (ExoIconView *icon_view, GtkAdjustment *hadjustment, GtkAdjustment *vadjustment, gpointer user_data); "toggle-cursor-item" void user_function (ExoIconView *icon_view, gpointer user_data); "unselect-all" void user_function (ExoIconView *icon_view, gpointer user_data);

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ExoIconView provides an alternative view on a list model. It displays the model as a grid of icons with labels. Like GtkTreeView, it allows to select one or multiple items (depending on the selection mode, see exo_icon_view_set_selection_mode()). In addition to selection with the arrow keys, ExoIconView supports rubberband selection, which is controlled by dragging the pointer.

refsect2.title: ExoIconView
refsect2.para: The ExoIconView struct contains only private fields and should not be directly accessed.

refsect2.title: exo_icon_view_new_with_model ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new ExoIconView widget with the model model.

refsect2.title: exo_icon_view_get_model ()
refsect2.para: Returns the model the ExoIconView is based on. Returns NULL if the model is unset.

listitem.simpara: A GtkTreeModel, or NULL if none is currently being used.

refsect2.title: exo_icon_view_set_model ()
refsect2.para: Sets the model for a ExoIconView. If the icon_view already has a model set, it will remove it before setting the new model. If model is NULL, then it will unset the old model.

refsect2.title: exo_icon_view_get_text_column ()
refsect2.para: Returns the column with text for icon_view.

listitem.simpara: the text column, or -1 if it's unset.

refsect2.title: exo_icon_view_set_text_column ()
refsect2.para: Sets the column with text for icon_view to be column. The text column must be of type G_TYPE_STRING.

listitem.simpara: A column in the currently used model.

refsect2.title: exo_icon_view_get_markup_column ()
refsect2.para: Returns the column with markup text for icon_view.

listitem.simpara: the markup column, or -1 if it's unset.

refsect2.title: exo_icon_view_set_markup_column ()
refsect2.para: Sets the column with markup information for icon_view to be column. The markup column must be of type G_TYPE_STRING. If the markup column is set to something, it overrides the text column set by exo_icon_view_set_text_column().

listitem.simpara: A column in the currently used model.

refsect2.title: exo_icon_view_get_pixbuf_column ()
refsect2.para: Returns the column with pixbufs for icon_view.

listitem.simpara: the pixbuf column, or -1 if it's unset.

refsect2.title: exo_icon_view_set_pixbuf_column ()
refsect2.para: Sets the column with pixbufs for icon_view to be column. The pixbuf column must be of type GDK_TYPE_PIXBUF

listitem.simpara: A column in the currently used model.

refsect2.title: exo_icon_view_get_orientation ()
refsect2.para: Returns the value of the ::orientation property which determines whether the labels are drawn beside the icons instead of below.

listitem.simpara: the relative position of texts and icons

refsect2.title: exo_icon_view_set_orientation ()
refsect2.para: Sets the ::orientation property which determines whether the labels are drawn beside the icons instead of below.

listitem.simpara: the relative position of texts and icons

refsect2.title: exo_icon_view_get_selection_mode ()
refsect2.para: Gets the selection mode of the icon_view.

refsect2.title: exo_icon_view_set_selection_mode ()
refsect2.para: Sets the selection mode of the icon_view.

refsect2.title: exo_icon_view_get_path_at_pos ()
refsect2.para: Finds the path at the point (x, y), relative to widget coordinates. See exo_icon_view_get_item_at_pos(), if you are also interested in the cell at the specified position.

listitem.simpara: The x position to be identified
The y position to be identified
The GtkTreePath corresponding to the icon or NULL if no icon exists at that position.

refsect2.title: exo_icon_view_selected_foreach ()
refsect2.para: Calls a function for each selected icon. Note that the model or selection cannot be modified from within this function.

listitem.simpara: The funcion to call for each selected icon.
User data to pass to the function.

refsect2.title: exo_icon_view_path_is_selected ()
refsect2.para: Returns TRUE if the icon pointed to by path is currently selected. If icon does not point to a valid location, FALSE is returned.

listitem.simpara: A GtkTreePath to check selection on.

refsect2.title: exo_icon_view_get_selected_items ()
refsect2.para: Creates a list of paths of all selected items. Additionally, if you are planning on modifying the model after calling this function, you may want to convert the returned list into a list of GtkTreeRowReferences. To do this, you can use gtk_tree_row_reference_new().

listitem.simpara: A GList containing a GtkTreePath for each selected row.

refsect2.title: exo_icon_view_select_all ()
refsect2.para: Selects all the icons. icon_view must has its selection mode set to GTK_SELECTION_MULTIPLE.

refsect2.title: exo_icon_view_item_activated ()
refsect2.para: Activates the item determined by path.

refsect2.title: The "column-spacing" property
refsect2.para: Space which is inserted between grid column.

refsect2.title: The "item-width" property
refsect2.para: The width used for each item.

refsect2.title: The "margin" property
refsect2.para: Space which is inserted at the edges of the icon view.

refsect2.title: The "markup-column" property
refsect2.para: Model column used to retrieve the text if using Pango markup.

refsect2.title: The "model" property
refsect2.para: The model for the icon view.

refsect2.title: The "orientation" property
refsect2.para: How the text and icon of each item are positioned relative to each other.

refsect2.title: The "pixbuf-column" property
refsect2.para: Model column used to retrieve the icon pixbuf from.

refsect2.title: The "row-spacing" property
refsect2.para: Space which is inserted between grid rows.

refsect2.title: The "spacing" property
refsect2.para: Space which is inserted between cells of an item.

refsect2.title: The "text-column" property
refsect2.para: Model column used to retrieve the text from.

listitem.simpara: user data set when the signal handler was connected.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "move-cursor" signal
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean user_function (ExoIconView *icon_view, GtkMovementStep step, gint count, gpointer user_data);

listitem.simpara: user data set when the signal handler was connected.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "set-scroll-adjustments" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (ExoIconView *icon_view, GtkAdjustment *hadjustment, GtkAdjustment *vadjustment, gpointer user_data);

listitem.simpara: user data set when the signal handler was connected.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.
